cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the problem of detecting fake news articles, which is a common topic in the natural language processing (NLP) community. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a data-driven approach for constructing discourse-level structures, which involves machine learning techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely category. The proposed approach also involves identifying insightful structure-related properties, which can be seen as a feature selection problem, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible category. The paper also involves analyzing the differences between real and fake news articles, which can be seen as a classification problem, making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) another possible category. Finally, the paper involves using text data to detect fake news, which can be seen as an information retrieval problem, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible category as well.
